info.name: rest-notify-gw-service
info.description: # üöÄ Get started here This template guides you through CRUD operations (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), variables, and tests. ## üîñ **How to use this template** #### **Step 1: Send requests** RESTful APIs allow you to perform CRUD operations using the POST, GET, PUT, and DELETE HTTP methods. This collection contains each of these [request](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/requests/) types. Open each request and click "Send" to see what happens. #### **Step 2: View responses** Observe the response tab for status code (200 OK), response time, and size. #### **Step 3: Send new Body data** Update or add new data in "Body" in the POST request. Typically, Body data is also used in PUT request. ``` { "name": "Add your name in the body" } ``` #### **Step 4: Update the variable** Variables enable you to store and reuse values in Postman. We have created a [variable](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/) called `base_url` with the sample request [https://postman-api-learner.glitch.me](https://postman-api-learner.glitch.me). Replace it with your API endpoint to customize this collection. #### **Step 5: Add tests in the "Tests" tab** Tests help you confirm that your API is working as expected. You can write test scripts in JavaScript and view the output in the "Test Results" tab. ## üí™ Pro tips - Use folders to group related requests and organize the collection. - Add more [scripts](https://learning.postman.com/docs/writing-scripts/intro-to-scripts/) in "Tests" to verify if the API works as expected and execute workflows. ## üí°Related templates [API testing basics](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=e9a37a28-055b-49cd-8c7e-97494a21eb54&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719) [API documentation](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=e9c28f47-1253-44af-a2f3-20dce4da1f18&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719) [Authorization methods](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=31a9a6ed-4cdf-4ced-984c-d12c9aec1c27&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719)

Join our small but growing engineering team by making a significant impact when building our in-house products and solving complex problems from startups seeking our help.

AS A Sr.
FULL-STACK WEB DEVELOPER, YOU‚ÄôLL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

Developing solutions for challenging projects.
Building MVP experiments for new product ideas.
Helping to architect front-end/backend frameworks.
Working well with other team members to make smart decisions.
Being able to deliver on time.

Y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫±ng c·∫•p (t·ªëi thi·ªÉu): Trung c·∫•p - Ngh·ªÅ

Y√™u c·∫ßu c√¥ng vi·ªác:

WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR FROM YOU

A smart and driven developer motivated to build great products and learn new skills.
Great communication skills and a desire to collaborate with the team.
Strong experience in building web applications.
An interest in taking on more responsibility and ownership over time.
Ability to solve complex and challenging problems.
Taking pride in your work with the ability to write clean code and tests.
QUALIFICATIONS
Frontend: Having strong experience with at least one of the major javascript frameworks such as React (preferred), Angular, Vue, and Ember.
Backend: Having strong experience with at least one backend framework:Node.js framework is preferred or includes programming languages such as Python, Java, and Rust.
Experience with building large, complex projects is a plus.
Working with open-source projects is a plus.
Expertise in analytical and problem-solving skills is a big plus.
Experience with Cloud platforms such as AWS is a must (Solution Architect Certificate is a big plus), and Google Cloud and Azure are a plus.
Experience with Continuous Integration/Deployment (such as CircleCI, GoCD, Jenkins)
Experience with Kubernetes (k8s, EKS), Jenkins, Terraform.
Good verbal English communication skills, especially in the global software development environment.
Have several years of working on a product that has gone into production and is large enough (engineer team size is at least 10 people).
BENEFITS AND PERKS
Competitive net salary
At least one month's salary bonus based on your performance every year.
Performance and salary reviewed every 6 months.
Flexible time off (everyone needs to be responsible for their schedule, we do not count the days off).
All public holidays.
Annual health check.
Premium health insurance from Bao Viet.
Standard social insurance, health insurance, and unemployment insurance.
Company trip: 1 time/year.
Mini team building: 3-4 times/year.
Reimbursement for English and technical courses/books.
Office entertainment allowance
Free snacks and drinks.
Weekly happy hour.
Private English class.
Football, badminton, and book clubs
